Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Question Name
Field.HelpDefault: Not displayed on the site. This is a short name you give to this question so you can find it easily later.

Field.Name: headline
Field.Caption: Section Headline
Field.HelpDefault: An optional large bold (h2 headline) caption that appears above the question. Use a headline to divide a form's questions into sections where appropriate.

Field.Name: caption
Field.Caption: Question
Field.HelpDefault: The question you are asking (h3 headline).

Field.Name: description
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. This description appears are regular size text below the question and above the answer area. Use this areas for instructions and description to help the user understand the input required.

Field.Name: required
Field.Caption: Required
Field.HelpDefault: Check this box if the field is required for the form to be submitted

Field.Name: inputTypeId
Field.Caption: Question Type
Field.LookupList: Short Text Answer,Long Text Answer,Check Boxes choose one,Radio Boxes choose many,Upload File,Select List choose one
Field.HelpDefault: The type of field (TEXT,TEXTAREA,CHECKBOX,RADIO,FILE,SELECT): Text for short text fields, TextArea for longer text fields, Radio (to choose one of the listed options), Checkbox (to select multiple listed options), Select (to select one listed option in a dropdown) and File (to upload an image file)

Field.Name: inputtype
Field.Caption: Input Type
Field.HelpDefault: The type of field (TEXT,TEXTAREA,CHECKBOX,RADIO,FILE,SELECT): Text for short text fields, TextArea for longer text fields, Radio (to choose one of the listed options), Checkbox (to select multiple listed options), Select (to select one listed option in a dropdown) and File (to upload an image file)

Field.Name: optionlist
Field.Caption: Option List
Field.HelpDefault: A short list of choices separated by commas for radio or checkbox fields. The maximum length of this field is255 characters. For example to create a choice between red and blue, enter "red,blue" (without the quotes.)

Field.Name: sortorder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: The order of fields on the form. Use alpha numeric text like a,b, and c, or 001, 002, 010, 011, etc..

Field.Name: formid
Field.Caption: Form
Field.HelpDefault: The form on which this question appears.

Field.Name: contentfieldid
Field.Caption: Content Field
Field.HelpDefault: If this field maps to a table field, this is the field.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Form Name
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Not visible on the website. Use to identify this form set in a list.

Field.Name: addResetButton
Field.Caption: Add Reset Button
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, a reset button is added to all pages of this form to clear the input and take the user back to the first page.

Field.Name: resetButtonName
Field.Caption: Reset Button Text
Field.HelpDefault: If a reset button is included, this text that appears on the Reset button.

Field.Name: backButtonName
Field.Caption: Back Button Text
Field.HelpDefault: If the form includes multiple pages, this is the text that appears on the back button used to move backward between pages.

Field.Name: continueButtonName
Field.Caption: Continue Button Text
Field.HelpDefault: If the form includes multiple pages, this is the text that appears on the continue button used to move forward between pages.

Field.Name: submitButtonName
Field.Caption: Submit Button Text
Field.HelpDefault: The text that appears on the submit button on the last page of the form.

Field.Name: saveButtonName
Field.Caption: Save Button Text
Field.HelpDefault: The text that appears on the save button

Field.Name: notificationemailid
Field.Caption: Notification System Email
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. When the user completes this form set, this system email will be sent to Site Managers with all the values entered from all forms in the form set.

Field.Name: responseemailid
Field.Caption: Auto-Responder System Email
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. When the user completes this form set, this system email will be sent to the user.

Field.Name: thankyoucopy
Field.Caption: Thank You Page
Field.DefaultValue: Thank you. Your information has been submitted successfully.
Field.HelpDefault: When the user completes the form set, they will be shown this copy.

Field.Name: allowRecaptcha
Field.Caption: Include Bot Detect
Field.HelpDefault: Include a recaptcha bot blocker (ask if the user is a human) on the first page of the form.

Field.Name: useUserProperty
Field.Caption: Use User Properties
Field.HelpDefault: When checked user properties will be used

Field.Name: joingroupid
Field.Caption: Join Group on Completion
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. When the user completes this form set, they will be added to this group.

Field.Name: padtop
Field.Caption: Top Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padright
Field.Caption: Right Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padbottom
Field.Caption: Bottom Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padleft
Field.Caption: Left Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: backgroundimagefilename
Field.Caption: Background Image
Field.HelpDefault: Add a background image to the design block. It will be reduced in size to cover the entire background.

Field.Name: asfullbleed
Field.Caption: Include Margins for Content
Field.HelpDefault: When not checked, the content always extends to the right and left edge of the widget. When checked, a margin on the right and left is created for wide screens. The design block background will still extend to the edge of the widget. Some templates may include their own right and left margin.

Field.Name: styleheight
Field.Caption: Height (with units)
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Set a style height and the design block will be forced this this height. Include both the number and the units, like 500px or 20em.

Field.Name: themestyleid
Field.Caption: Layout Wrapper Class
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Select a css class selector to be added to the block's wrapper. Use this feature to customize the layout styles. To add a custom style, add the css class selector in the content 'Design Block Themes' and add the css code to the style sheet in the site's theme addon.

Field.Name: fontstyleid
Field.Caption: Optional Layout Wrapper Class for Font (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: deprecated

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Form Page Name
Field.HelpDefault: Enter a short name for this page of the online form. An online form may have several pages. This name does not appear on your public form but a relevant name will help you organize your content.

Field.Name: description
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: Enter optional form instructions. These instructions appear at the top of this page.

Field.Name: saveTypeId
Field.Caption: How to Save Data
Field.HelpDefault: Form data will always be saved to the User Form Response table. Select People or Organizations to save data to those tables when field names match.
If How to Save Data is set to Custom Content, enter the name of the content here. If it does not exist it will be added.

Field.Name: sortorder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: An alpha numeric string used to order this form (page) and other forms in this FormSet.

Field.Name: formsetid
Field.Caption: Form Set
Field.HelpDefault: Select the FormSet. A FormSet is an online form placed on a page. It can have one or more pages (forms).

Field.Name: addcancelbutton
Field.Caption: Add REset Button
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, a reset button is added to this form to clear the input and take the user back to the first page.

Field.Name: cancelbuttonname
Field.Caption: Reset Button
Field.HelpDefault: The text that appears on the Reset button.

Field.Name: backbuttonname
Field.Caption: Back Button Name
Field.HelpDefault: Optional, the text that appears on the back button.

Field.Name: continuebuttonname
Field.Caption: Continue Button Name
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. If the form includes mulitple pages, this is the name of the button that moves forward between pages.

Field.Name: submitbuttonname
Field.Caption: Submit Button Name
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. The name of the button that submits the completed form.

Field.Name: saveCustomContent
Field.Caption: Custom Content (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: If How to Save Data is set to Custom Content, enter the name of the content here. If it does not exist it will be added.

Field.Name: nextformid
Field.Caption: Next Form (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the next form in the form set.

Field.Name: addcontinuebutton
Field.Caption: Add Continue Button (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, a continue button is added to this form to take the user to the next form in the FormSet.

Field.Name: addbackbutton
Field.Caption: Add Back Button (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, a back button is added to this form to take the user to the previous form in a multi-page FormSet.
